definition: to live without purpose
to steal/to pilfer/to snatch/thief/stealthily
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
to bear humiliation to save one's skin (idiom)
to bear humiliation to save one's skin (idiom)

sentences.english: I'm just surviving, that's why I want you to know.
sentences.chinese: 我是在苟且偷生，這就是爲什麼我想讓你知道。

sentences.english: It's better to die with hornor than to live in infamy .
sentences.chinese: 與其苟且偷生不如光榮而死。

sentences.english: Run, and you'll live… at least a while.
sentences.chinese: 逃跑，至少能苟且偷生，年復一年，直到壽終正寢。

sentences.english: He would rather die than live in dishonour.
Run, and you will live at least a while.
sentences.chinese: 逃跑，至少能苟且偷生，年復一年，直到壽終正寢。

sentences.english: It would be better to pull the plug on him than to keep his life in such a torture.
sentences.chinese: 與其讓他在這種折磨中敬且偷生，不如讓他安樂死去。

sentences.english: Run, and you'll live at least a while.
sentences.chinese: 逃跑，至少能苟且偷生，年復一年，直到壽終正寢。

sentences.english: Unlike many men who lived long after, Henry Young did not die in vain.
sentences.chinese: 與許多苟且偷生的人不同，亨利揚不要白白地死去。

sentences.english: Lord, let me never, never, outlive my love for thee.
sentences.chinese: 主，我莫苟且偷生，如若對你愛減退。

sentences.english: It saved one's skin; but it did not help the growth of a complex economy.
sentences.chinese: 這樣苟且偷生，但對發展綜合經濟卻無任何幫助。

sentences.english: I had rather die than live in dishonor.
sentences.chinese: 我寧可死也不願苟且偷生。

sentences.english: They purchase life at the expense of honour.
He would rather die than live in dishonor.
He would rather die than live in dishonour .
Better die with honour than live with shame.
sentences.chinese: 與其忍辱偷生，不如光榮而死。

to drift through life

remaining breath/last gasp
survival/the struggle to eke out a living/to seek for continued existence
to struggle on whilst at death's door (idiom)
to meet death

seeking only ease and comfort (idiom); making no attempt to improve oneself/taking things easily without attending to responsibilities
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
life/to survive/to save a life/to scrape a living
to commit suicide
better a bad life than a good death (idiom)

definition: variant of 畜生[chu4 sheng5]
to extend one's neck in preparation for execution (idiom)
